page.title: 08HOPTON
page.content: Hopton is a very quiet village. It has many shops and activities such as an Art Gallery and a Pottery shop. The village shop provides most of the groceries. There is one primary school and a playgroup. The village has its own doctor. There is one bus daily which takes workers to Bury St. Edmunds. The houses in Hopton are mostly old; there are 12 old people's bungalows. All Saints Church has an average congregation of 40 people. There is a pantomime every year and an old people's club, a youth club, concerts and fetes. The surrounding countryside is mostly for growing crops. Many residents of Hopton are employed on the surrounding land, at Riddlesworth Hall and in Diss, Thetford and Bury St. Edmunds.
